p: Between Aug 10, 2016, and May 3, 2018, 1196 samples were obtained from imported camels before being offloaded at the Port of Jeddah, of which 868 originated from Sudan and 328 from Djibouti. And between May 1, and June 25, 2018, we obtained samples from 472 local camels, 189 in Riyadh and 283 in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia ( table). Testing by RT-PCR identified MERS-CoV in 381 (22·8%) of 1668 animals sampled, and the prevalence of MERS-CoV was significantly higher among local camels than imported camels (224 [47·5%] of 472 local camels vs 157 [13·1%] of 1196 imported camels; χ 2 test p<0·0001).
